events.name: Microsoft Tech Summit Singapore 2017 - Day 2
events.description: Day 2 of Microsoft Tech Summit Singapore 2017, a 2 day event hosted by Microsoft. You must register with the event to book your seat. Description: "Build your cloud and infrastructure skills with a two-day free technical training event." More information: https://www.microsoft.com/en-sg/techsummit/singapore.aspx Agenda: Tuesday, March 14 10:00 am-11:15 am - An Overview of the Microsoft Application Platform for Developers (repeat) Enable a new world of work with Office 365 Identity Modernize your Data Platform with SQL technologies (repeat) Move all your communications to Skype for Business Online (repeat) Powering IT Transformation with Office 365 (repeat) Redefine productivity with the latest Microsoft Office 2016 Features on Windows 10 Reinventing IT infrastructure for business agility (repeat) Secure and manage your digital transformation (repeat) The future is closer than you think; broadly deploying Windows 10 for business (repeat) 11:30 am-12:45 pm - Accelerating Office 365 deployment and user adoption Architecting robust Big Data Solutions with Azure Enhance Windows 10 deployment: what's new with Windows 10 deployment? Intelligence throughout Office 365: Delve, MyAnalytics, and Microsoft Graph-powered experiences Let your apps and services take a front seat in Outlook with Actionable Messages Take advantage of new capabilities in System Center 2016 Use Azure Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) as a starting point on your cloud journey What's new in Office 365 management: Usage reporting, change management and service health 1:45 pm-3:00 pm - Building Serverless Applications with Azure Functions Create a lab environment in Azure and LOB Apps in Azure Develop for the Universal Windows Platform on Windows 10: What's New Explore OneDrive for Business key features and roadmap Microsoft Azure networking: getting things connected Office 365 Groups – Overview & Administration Protect your data with a modern backup, archive and disaster recovery solution SQL Server v.Next with Support on Linux, Windows and Containers Take control of your data with intelligent compliance in Office 365 3:15 pm-4:30 pm - Build Microservices and container solutions using Azure Service Fabric and Azure Container Service Cyber Resilience through building a Secure Modern Enterprise Discover Implementation Best Practices, Monitoring & Diagnostics tools for your Azure applications Explore cross-platform mobile development end-to-end with Xamarin Explore Microsoft Windows Server 2016 Application Platform Get the most out of the Office 365 security solutions Implement Windows as a Service: understanding how to do it Migrating to Exchange Online via Hybrid – over the long haul Port your AWS knowledge to Azure  ****You must register with the event to book your seat**** Register here: https://www.microsoft.com/en-sg/techsummit/singapore.aspx For deeper engagement with Apache Apex, download, view past meetup webinars, slides, and docs.  To reduce time to market, look at operable app-templates that you can quickly import and launch.  Examples: HDFS-Sync, Kafka-HDFS, HDFS-Line-Copy, S3-HDFS and HDFS-Kafka. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.
events.location: Marina Bay Sands, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore
events.group_name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Singapore

events.name: March Meetup - Memory Forensics, Life of Bug Bounty, and NAD
events.description:
The venue can only fit 50. Seats are 1st come 1st serve. 


We have added Security Openings below, please refer them if you are looking out.  Agenda • Introduction & Announcements • "A primer on Memory Forensics" by Bart Inglot (45 mins) • "Life of a Bounty Hunter" by Quan Yang (45 mins) • "NAD - A Tool for Dynamic Hooking & Analysis of Android Application" by Han Lee (15 mins) 


Abstract:  Title: A primer on Memory Forensics Memory forensics is a powerful analysis and investigative technique used in digital forensics and incident response. With adversaries becoming more sophisticated and carrying out advanced malware attacks, detecting, responding and investigating such intrusions becomes critical to infosec professionals. This presentation introduces you to the topic of memory forensics, it explains how to acquire a memory image, perform analysis using Volatility Framework and demos a few plugins that the speaker developed himself to aid his investigations. Title: Life of a Bounty Hunter Bug bounties is a good source of alternative income as well as a pastime. Learn about the who, what, when, why, where and how about bug bounties and especially, learn first-hand on how to approach bug bounty programs in order to maximize bounties. Title: NAD - A Tool for Dynamic Hooking & Analysis of Android Application This tool is an attempt to be the Burp Suite for Android application methods. It provides the user with several abilities to ease such frustration and make life easier. 



Bio(s) of Speakers: Bart Inglot is an Incident Response and Forensics Specialist in MANDIANT's Security Consulting Services team helping clients restore confidence in an event of a breach. He holds a degree in Computer Forensics, is a keen developer, enjoys inspecting network traffic and specialises in Windows forensics. Quan Yang is a fresh graduate from NUS, and is a co-founder of NUS Greyhats. He is amongst the top 3 hackers on HackerOne this quarter and has previously interned at FireEye and Google. He has no certifications. Han Lee - Just your regular penetration tester.  Job Openings where our community members work: Junior Security Consultant - MWR Senior Consultant - Incident Response and Forensics - Mandiant Technology Consulting (Security) – Associate/ Senior Associate - PwC </a> <a href="https://careers.checkpoint.com/careers/index.php?m=joborders&a=show&jobOrderID=5377&country_code=SG">Regional Cloud Security Expert - Checkpoint Singapore Security Engineer, Public Sector - Checkpoint Singapore Senior Security Analyst - Ultimate Software Security Analyst - Ultimate Software CyberOps Consultant - Horangi CyberOps Researcher - Horangi  Security Consultant - Vantage Point
events.location: One Raffles Quay (North Tower), 1 Raffles Quay, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: StackUp Clinic: Real-Time Tech - Introduction to Server Push
events.description:
HTTP is a stateless request/response protocol where the client requests for the resource it needs, and the server processes the request and responds with the appropriate status and data. The HTTP protocol does not allow the server to send unsolicited messages to the client. This limitation can be problematic if you’re writing applications that require the occasional server push; for example, chats, multiplayer real-time games, or higher-bid notifications in an online auction
In this demo-oriented clinic, we will examine some of the techniques used to work around this limitation.
 
Agenda
1, What is Server Push?
2. Server Push Techniques (Online)

AJAX polling
AJAX long poll
Server Sent Events
Web Sockets

3. Alternatives

XMPP over HTTP (BOSH)

4. Offline notification (if time permits)

Push Notification with Push and Notification API

 
Speaker: Mr. Chuk Munn Lee
Chuk is with the Advanced Technology Applications practice in National University of Singapore, Institute of Systems Science (NUS-ISS). He teaches courses in Enterprise software engineering, software architecture, web technologies and Enterprise Java.
Prior to joining ISS, Chuk worked with Oracle and Sun Microsystems where he helped customers and partners across all industries in the APAC region to develop, size, and tune applications deployed to Java EE application Servers.
 
Reserving a Seat
Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat..
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: GTS Episode 3: Farewell Data Races; Safe Concurrency in Go vs Rust
events.description:
Concurrency by itself is easy until you start facing strange heisenbugs or hard to reproduce deadlocks. Safe concurrency is no piece of cake. Goroutines, channels, and select statement provided by Go make concurrent programming easy, but not necessarily safe. “Don't communicate by sharing memory; share memory by communicating. ” is idiomatic in Go, but it can hardly be enforced. In some cases using channels may be overkill, thus making "good old" synchronized sharing the most effective and convenient solution. However, sharing mutable data without proper synchronization leads to data races. This is the main cause of race conditions, aka Public Enemy #1. This talk will introduce two ways to avoid data races: detection in runtime with tools like the race detector provided by Go, and forbidding race conditions at compile time with the type system as Rust does. This talk will also explain why no data races does not mean no race conditions and will include a discussion on how to avoid race conditions in general. Speaker Cheng Wei Cheng Wei obtained his PhD degree from School of Computing, NUS on 2010, and then joined Garena and involved in various projects there. Since 2013, he worked as server team leader of BeeTalk, a social app having tens of millions of active users. 


Schedule 6:30 PM Registration, mingling and snacks 7:00 PM The Talk 8:00 PM PIZZA, and more mingling
events.location: Garena Office,  1 Fusionopolis Place, # 17-10, Galaxis Building, 138522, Singapore

events.name: PyData Meetup - March 2017
events.description:
Agenda  • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 8:00pm Presentation: Building Glorified Screensavers the Hard Way By Yin Shanyang • 8:00pm - 9:00pm Presentation: De-mystifying Data Stores by Vishnu Rao 


Synopsis: Let’s build a glorified screensaver using cellular automata, convolution autoencoders, t-sne dimensionality reduction, and recurrent neural networks. Or just come for the buzzword bingo. Bio: Yang runs the boutique generative design studio Swarm Synopsis: We have a lot of Relational & NoSql stores out there and each have their use cases. They differ mostly in the way they store data, and that that has an impact on how we access data and whether our use case is a fit or not.The talk is about giving a simple overview on how they store the data and hence highlight the importance of storage format when choosing a data store. Bio:  VishnuMySQL Enthusiast, Doodle Maker,Tango Lover & fellow coder@ http://dataspark.com . formerly@ http://www.flipkart.com  -india's largest e-commerce. Reachable at https://twitter.com/sweetweet213, https://mash213.wordpress.com, linkedin.com/in/213vishnu/ Updates •  Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors   Group Sponsor
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, Mapletree Business City, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117371

events.name: Stories in 3D Printing
events.description:
This month we will have speakers who will share with us stories of what they use their 3D printer for.

Talk 1: Leon Lim
Leon is a maker who recently got into 3D printing at the end of December 2015. He will be sharing how he combines 3D printing with wood working and electronics to create his projects.

Talk 2: Jason Loo
Jason will be talking about the applications of 3D printing in the entertainment industry for props and toys. His 3D printed artifacts includes a lifesize BB8 as well as a iron man mask.

Talk 3: Hanyang Leong
Often, 3d printed pieces taken right off the printbed will tend to appear raw, plasticky and unfinished. However, there are actually a myraid of post-processing techniques one can apply to take your 3d printed projects to a much better finish. Join us as we share some of the post-processing techniques we typically use in Funbie Studios to finish 3d printed projects - joining of smaller pieces, gap filling,  surface finishing and paintwork application. Some of the pieces will be showcased as part of the sharing too."

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-stories-in-3d-printing-tickets-32407802610
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: talk.js - Pi Day Special
events.description: Celebrate Pi Day (3.14) with the JavaScript community with a talk on WebAssembly by Noritada Shimizufrom Mozilla, Japan The venue will be held at PayPal Singapore office at Level 7 - Seats are limited due to venue capacity Agenda 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle with pizzas and drinks 7.30pm: Opening address by host 7.40pm: Start of scheduled talks 8.45pm: Open announcements 9.00pm: End of event Talk Introduction to WebAssembly - A new binary format for the Web Talk description WebAssembly is a new binary format which encodes programs running on web browsers such as Firefox, Chrome, etc. These binary formatted files are generated by compilers in the same way we generate native code from C/C++ source code. In this session, we will cover WebAssembly (what it is, what is the main objectives, how to generate it, and how to connect JavaScript programs) with some About the speaker Noritada Shimizu (Chiko) works for Mozilla as developer relationship in Tokyo, Japan. He is a member of Mozilla TechSpeakers. Technologies he is interested in are modern JavaScript, WebAssembly and Rust. He also loves beer, football, and learning new programming languages. Open announcements An open announcement is when anyone can make an announcement about a new meet up, job opportunities, upcoming events, or something you learnt. If you have a short announcement you'd like to share with the audience, you may do so during the open announcements segment. Important Please remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security (e.g. driver's license, passport, etc.) Sponsor(s) Venue sponsor: PayPal Food and drink sponsor: PayPal
events.location: Paypal at Suntec , 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: How To Build An Amazing Dev Team
events.description:
RSVP for free here: bit.ly/2mD1oJF

Speakers:
Ted Kuo (Head of Development, ZALORA)
Jakub Downar (Head of R&D, Finantix)
Artemis Mendrinos (Senior Manager, Digital at Accenture)
François De Serres (Head of Digital Technology, PALO IT Singapore)

"The secret of my success is that we have gone to exceptional lengths to hire the best people in the world." – Steve Jobs

Joinus and award-winning recruitment agency Xpand Group - Singapore at a sharing session to discover tips and tricks to building an amazing dev team. This session is catered toward hiring managers, company founders and developers where they'll pick up tips from recruitment experts, improve their knowledge of hiring tactics for developers and connect with others.

This session will be moderated by Clarisa Ele (Senior Consultant, Technology, Xpand Group - Singapore).
